706977f-a.title: Brooklyn: Surf Ave. - Stillwell Ave.
706977f-a.text:
Surf Ave., east from Stillwell Ave. to West 5th Street, showing a
principal street in Coney Island on a summer day. The Brooklyn Trust
Company, a branch bank, and Feltman's Restaurant are visible at the right;
across the street from there is the entrance to Luna Park, in the background
is a portion of Seaside Park.
About 1931.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
706977f-a.folder: Surf Ave. & Stillwell Ave., Brooklyn, NY

706901f-a.title: Brooklyn: Stillwell Avenue - Surf Avenue
706901f-a.text:
Stillwell Ave., aorth from Surf Ave., showing ow its N.W. corner the
Loew's Theatre buildiag uwder construction. Also shown is the Cowey Island
station of the 8.M.T. lines.
Mareh 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

706980f-a.title: Brooklyn: Surf Ave. - Stillwell Ave.
706980f-a.text:
1301-5 Surf Ave., at the N.W. corner of Stillwell Ave., showing the J. Mc
Donald Sea View Hotel, erected iw 1883 and deaolished iw March 1924.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collectioa.

706982f-a.title: Brooklyn: Surf Ave. - Stillwell Ave.
706982f-a.text:
Surf Ave., eaat,from stillwell Ave., ahowing in the left foreground at
the N.W. corner, Loew's Coney Island Theatre, beyond which is the entrance to
Luna Park. Note the crowds and cars that are always found in Coney Island on
summer weekends .
About 1925.
Ewing Galloway
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

706983f-a.title: Brooklyn: Surf Ave. - Stillwell Ave.
706983f-a.text:

About 1926.

706902f-a.title: Brooklyn: Stillwell Avenue - Surf Avenue
706902f-a.text:
Stillwell Ave., north from Surf Ave., showing a view northeast from the
B.M.T.terminal station on Stillwell Ave. To the right, partially see, is a
baseball field and standa, and beyond it is the Brooklyn Borough Gas Co.
tmnks.
October 1928.
'ugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706908f-b.title: Brooklyn: Stillwell Avenue - Surf Avenue
706908f-b.text:
(1)
Stillwell Ave., north from Coney lIsland (Reigelmann) Boardwalk to
Surf Ave., showing demolition in progress for the extension d this Ave.,
to the 'Boardwalk'.
January 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The samme, slightly northward.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
A view north of the Bowery. On the right appears Stratton Walk,
which will become a part of this new thoroughfare.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Cellection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same as No. 1, at a later date, and showing the new Avenne.
Novemke 1924.
Eugene L. Armkruster Collection.

706974f-c.title: Brooklyn: Surf Ave. - Stillwell Ave.
706974f-c.text:
(1)
Surf Ave., south side, between Stillwell Ave., and Stratton Hender-
son Walk. Stratton Walk which ran north and southwards narall: 1 to
Henderson's Restaurant, is now (1929)3tillwell Ave. This view shows
a portion of the Henderson estaurant site being utilized for the widen-
ing and opening of Stillwell Ave. The building at the right, was
Shafer's Hotel in 1883.
DDecember 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(2)
The same, a further view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same, another view.
December 1923.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(4)
The same, showing the modernized Henderson Restaurant and Stillwell
Ave., completed.
July 1924.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
